title: Niger’s junta closes the country’s airspace amid regional standoff
description: Backroom negotiations are continuing over the ouster of President Mohamed Bazoum.

title: China hacked Japan’s sensitive defense networks, officials say
description: Beijing's compromise of Tokyo's classified cyber networks could prevent greater strategic coordination between Japan's Ministry of Defense and the Pentagon.

title: Britain begins detaining migrants on barge firefighters called ‘deathtrap’
description: The football-field-sized Bibby Stockholm has been retrofitted to hold 500 men. The government says it's cheaper than housing them in hotels.

title: Latest Mediterranean shipwrecks leave 82 migrants missing in one weekend
description: The climbing number of people willing to risk their lives on a famously deadly route epitomizes the desperate living conditions felt across the region.

title: Woman arrested in plot to kill Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky
description: Ukraine's State Security Service said it had detained a woman who was trying to track the president's movements during a visit to the southern regions of Mykolaiv and Odessa in late July.

title: He visited all 195 countries without flying. It nearly broke him.
description: Torbjorn Pedersen returned home to Denmark after he said he visited all 195 countries without flying, in a nearly decade-long journey.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv says peace talks in Jeddah were ‘productive.’ Moscow called them ‘futile.’
description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba reportedly hailed Beijing’s participation as a “breakthrough,” as Kyiv attempts to expand its partnerships.

title: ‘Tomorrow’s martyrs’: Inside a Palestinian militant cell in the West Bank
description: The Washington Post gained rare access to a group of fighters in Nablus, affording a window into the lives and actions of the West Bank’s new generation of militants.

title: Mongolia looks to rise out of China and Russia’s shadow
description: Mongolian Prime Minister Luvsannamsrain Oyun-Erdene spoke with Today’s WorldView about the complexities of his country’s position in between China and Russia.
